summary: 21-year-old male patient reporting a runny nose as his only current symptom.  No past medical history, current medications, or known allergies reported.
followup_notes: Added duration of runny nose symptom.
specialist_rationale: A runny nose for 5 days suggests a common cold or similar upper respiratory infection.  A General Practitioner can assess the symptoms and determine if further testing or treatment is needed.  Specialists are not typically required for this.
